div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 410 Paeonia, 1968 Burial: c. 315-310 B.C. (T) Contents: c. 68 AV, c. 1900 AR Philip II: 23 lifetime and post. st. (incl. Abydus 3, Lampsacus 1) 105 lifetime and post. tetradr. (to â‚ª and symbols) Alexander III: 3 lifetime dist. (Amphi- polis 2, Sicyon 1) 34 lifetime and early post. st. (Amphipolis 8, Lampsacus 3, Abydus 1, Sardes 2, Magnesia 1, Miletus 2, Cyprus 4, Side 1, Sidon 4, Ace 2, Babylon 1, unc. 5) Philip III: 8 st. (Abydus 2, Sardes 3, Babylon 1, unc. 2) Lycceius: 13 tetradr. Patraus: 1700-1800 tetradr. CNG coin shop 767800 Imit. Patraus: 34 tetradr. Disposition: Sotheby April 16, 1969; Parke- Bernet Dec. 9, 1969 Coins in the two sales undoubtedly com- prise the bulk of the hd. The statistics for Patraus may be exaggerated as a result of duplication. Citations in Parke-Bernet of Sotheby pieces gen- erally refer to die identities, but PB 217-8 are the same coins as S. 507, 512. Since neither sale is fully illus- trated, it is impossible to check the extent of the carry-over from one auction to the other.
